body_html:
Hi @jeffdaily,

I am using Ubuntu 18.04. Currently the bazel version that is supported on this system is 0.19.1.
The usage of bazel 0.18.1 can be only made manually (and it is kind of a downgrade), which I find to be an ugly solution.
It is a pity that tensorflow build cannot now be done as easy as before.

How is that a 'pity' and 'ugly' solution?? There are bugs introduced in any new version of software, that's why there is supported version of bazel and not support version of bazel.

> Hi @jeffdaily,
> 
> I am using Ubuntu 18.04. Currently the bazel version that is supported on this system is 0.19.1.
> The usage of bazel 0.18.1 can be only made manually (and it is kind of a downgrade), which I find to be an ugly solution.
> It is a pity that tensorflow build cannot now be done as easy as before.

How is that a 'pity' and 'ugly' solution?? There are bugs introduced in any new version of software, that's why there is supported version of bazel and not support version of bazel.
